resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson opened a new pull request #8197:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8197


   Also adds tests that run on minio, which I've tested locally. 
   
   To do:
   
   - [ ] Add minio tests to a CI job?
   - [ ] Update docs for S3FileSystem to include S3Options args
   - [ ] Add `filesystem` argument to `read_/write_` functions? `open/write_dataset`?
   - [ ] Update S3 vignette to show how to construct S3FileSystem from args, not just URI
   - [ ] Implement ARN/STS auth (look at Python impl)

romainfrancois commented on a change in pull request #8197:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8197#discussion_r494325934



##########
File path: r/R/ipc_stream.R
##########
@@ -90,16 +90,18 @@ write_to_raw <- function(x, format = c("stream", "file")) {
 #' open.
 #' @param as_data_frame Should the function return a `data.frame` (default) or
 #' an Arrow [Table]?
+#' @param filesystem A [FileSystem] where `file` can be found if it is a
+#' string file path; default is the local file system
 #' @param ... extra parameters passed to `read_feather()`.
 #'
 #' @return A `data.frame` if `as_data_frame` is `TRUE` (the default), or an
 #' Arrow [Table] otherwise
 #' @seealso [read_feather()] for writing IPC files. [RecordBatchReader] for a
 #' lower-level interface.
 #' @export
-read_ipc_stream <- function(file, as_data_frame = TRUE, ...) {
+read_ipc_stream <- function(file, as_data_frame = TRUE, filesystem = NULL, ...) {
   if (!inherits(file, "InputStream")) {

Review comment:
       There are a lot of this happening. Does this really need `file=` and `filesystem`. Can this be something like: 
   
   ```r
   read_ipc_stream(filesystem$open(file))
   ```
   
   ?




----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on a change in pull request #8197:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8197#discussion_r494396737



##########
File path: r/R/ipc_stream.R
##########
@@ -90,16 +90,18 @@ write_to_raw <- function(x, format = c("stream", "file")) {
 #' open.
 #' @param as_data_frame Should the function return a `data.frame` (default) or
 #' an Arrow [Table]?
+#' @param filesystem A [FileSystem] where `file` can be found if it is a
+#' string file path; default is the local file system
 #' @param ... extra parameters passed to `read_feather()`.
 #'
 #' @return A `data.frame` if `as_data_frame` is `TRUE` (the default), or an
 #' Arrow [Table] otherwise
 #' @seealso [read_feather()] for writing IPC files. [RecordBatchReader] for a
 #' lower-level interface.
 #' @export
-read_ipc_stream <- function(file, as_data_frame = TRUE, ...) {
+read_ipc_stream <- function(file, as_data_frame = TRUE, filesystem = NULL, ...) {
   if (!inherits(file, "InputStream")) {

Review comment:
       Unfortunately, it's spelled `filesystem$OpenInputStream(file)` if it's for reading, or `filesystem$OpenOutputStream(file)` for writing. I resisted adding the extra argument, but I thought it was less bad than requiring users to learn those. 
   
   But we could think of other solutions. One possibility is having some sort of `FileLocator` object that is filesystem + path; we've started exploring that in places in the C++ library, and I've been looking into similar things for ARROW-9870. Maybe we could revisit this question in that PR (next week-ish)?




----------------------------------------------------------------

   if (!inherits(file, "InputStream")) {

Review comment:

   But we could think of other solutions. One possibility is having some sort of `FileLocator` object that is filesystem + path; we've started exploring that in places in the C++ library, and I've been looking into similar things for ARROW-9870. Maybe we could revisit this question in that PR (next week-ish)?

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: Currently you can access data in S3 by URI, which can include auth and other query parameters (ARROW-9854), but you can't directly construct an S3Options object.
